snippet: Opponents of a raft of welfare changes that took effect this week want a government minister to put his money where his mouth is, and live on £53, about $80, a week.
abstract: Critics of welfare changes in Great Britain challenge Work and Pensions Sec Iain Duncan to live on 53 pounds per week, or about $80, amount one welfare recipient said he had left after paying for housing and heat.
lead_paragraph: Opponents of a raft of welfare changes that took effect this week want a government minister to put his money where his mouth is, and live on £53, about $80, a week.

headline.seo: Britain: Critics Challenge Official to Try Living on Welfare
headline.main: Britain: Critics Challenge Official to Try Living on Welfare
headline.print_headline: Britain: Critics Challenge Official To Try Living on Welfare
